snippet: The Affordable Care Act requires employers with more than 50 full-time workers to offer insurance, but many find few low-income employees will buy it.
abstract: Many small-business owners with 100 or more employees say very few workers have been willing to buy health insurance they are required to offer under Affordable Care Act; reluctance to sign up is most prominent among low-wage workers, who deem so-called affordable insurance offered by employers too expensive for their budgets.
lead_paragraph: The Affordable Care Act requires employers with more than 50 full-time workers to offer insurance, but many find few low-income employees will buy it.

headline.main: Many Low-Income Workers Say ‘No’ to Health Insurance
headline.print_headline: Insurance Out of Reach for Many, Despite Law

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
